item.title: When sky is not the limit: nature’s light show among the stars
item.author: Exploring Hobbit,
item.description: The enchanting Aurora Borealis, or northern lights, frolic in the sky when charged particles from the sun become trapped in the Earth’s magnetic field, emitting colourful lights of green, scarlet, crimson, and more. The lights unravel themselves usually on dark clear nights. It is proposed that the …
